intro: Ebnerella armillata, commonly known as the ringed bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Ebnerella armillata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or rocky habitats.
